alert.note: Alert for Putnam (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 07 at 7:46PM CDT until May 07 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CDT FOR PUTNAM...SOUTHEASTERN HENRY AND SOUTHERN BUREAU COUNTIES... At 746 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Providence, or 13 miles southwest of Princeton, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Princeton, Hennepin, Spring Valley, Henry, DePue, Granville, Wyanet, Sheffield, Tiskilwa, Dalzell, Buda, Bureau Junction, McNabb, Putnam, Mark, Neponset, Seatonville, Magnolia, Standard and Milo. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
